alert.note: Alert for Huron; Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 5:02PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...BANDS OF SNOW FROM LAKE HURON DURING LATE AFTERNOON CONTINUES THROUGH EARLY EVENING... WEATHER... * Bands of snow moving inland from Lake Huron will be heavy at times leading to reduced visibility and snow cover on untreated roads. * Snow showers continue across the eastern half of Huron county and move into northeast Sanilac county by 6 PM. Activity persists in these areas through 8 PM and then moves offshore during mid to late evening. * Snow accumulation up to 2 inches is expected mainly along and east of M-53 and M-19 between 5 PM and 8 PM. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow will lead to slick conditions on untreated roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Bursts of heavier snow will reduce visibility for motorists with wide variations over short distances. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by traveling and slower speed and allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
